intro: Prionosciadium palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's devil's lettuce, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
